Description:
Universally acclaimed by everyone from Garry Trudeau to Matt Groening as completely brilliant, Scott McCloud's Understanding Comics, a comic book about comics, makes the case for comics as a valid literary form (as more than pulp and kids' stuff).

Join him for an exhilarating trip through the inner workings of comics—what they are, how they work and what they could be—and hear about his newest book, The Sculptor, a graphic novel.

There will be a selling of Scott McCloud's new book, The Sculptor, following the event.

 

Can't make it to the event? Leave your questions for our guests below, and they might be used on stage during the Q&A. Keep an eye on 92Y On Demand after the event for any video clips we might share! You might see your question used on stage.

 
 

Brief Bio

Scott McCloud is the award-winning author of Understanding Comics, Making Comics, Zot! and many other fiction and non-fiction comics spanning 30 years. An internationally-recognized authority on comics and visual communication, technology and the power of storytelling, McCloud has lectured at Google, Pixar, Sony and the Smithsonian Institution. His online thoughts, stories and inventions can be found at scottmccloud.com. First Second's The Sculptor is his most recent book.
ShortDesc: Universally acclaimed by everyone from Garry Trudeau to Matt Groening as completely brilliant, Scott McCloud's Understanding Comics, a comic book about comics, makes the case for comics as a valid literary form (as more than pulp and kids' stuff).
Title: All About Comics with Scott McCloud

Description:
Jim Gaffigan is a Grammy nominated comedian, New York Times bestselling author, top touring performer and multi-platinum selling father of five.

His fourth hour special (Beyond the Pale 2006, King Baby 2009, Mr. Universe 2012), Obsessed premiered on Comedy Central on Apr 27, 2014 and the DVD/CD was released on Apr 29 by Comedy Central Records. Obsessed premiered at #1 on iTunes which gave Gaffigan five albums in the Top 25 Comedy category on iTunes.

In May of 2013, Jim’s first book Dad is Fat was released by Crown Publishing and debuted at #5 on The New York Time’s Bestseller’s List and remained on the list for 17 weeks after. His latest book Food: A Love Story debuted at #3 on the list.

Gaffigan has had breakout guest appearances on many comedies and dramas ranging from “Portlandia” to HBO's cult hits "Flight of the Concords" and "Bored to Death" to dramatic roles in all three versions of "Law & Order."

In recent years, Gaffigan has also become a mainstay on the big screen with memorable roles in Going the Distance, Away We Go and It's Kind of a Funny Story.

Further broadening his career, he starred in his first Broadway production, That Championship Season. As part of the highly acclaimed play, Gaffigan appeared in the ensemble alongside Chris Noth, Brian Cox, Jason Patric and Kiefer Sutherland.

He is currently on a 50-city national tour called Jim Gaffigan: The White Bread Tour.

Description:
Chilean conceptual artist Alfredo Jaar’s work is usually politically motivated, using strategies of representation of real events, the faces of war or the globalized world and, sometimes, viewer participation.

His work has been shown extensively, notably in the biennales of Venice, São Paulo, Istanbul, Kwangju, Johannesburg and Seville. He became a Guggenheim Fellow in 1985 and a MacArthur Fellow in 2000. In 2006 he received Spain’s Premio Extremadura a la Creación.

Description:
Art critic and historian Irving Sandler has provided first-hand accounts of modern American art, beginning with Abstract Expressionism in the 1950s, when he managed the Tanager Gallery and coordinated the New York artists’ ZT Club of the New York School.

Description:
It seems unimaginable now, but the works of Piero della Francesca and Vermeer were forgotten and neglected for longer than they have been admired.

No other great painter has been overlooked for such a long time as Botticelli. Hardly anyone paid much attention to Frans Hals and Giotto for many years. Why have tastes in art have been changing since art first came into being? Milton Esterow, former publisher of ARTnews, gives a fascinating perspective.

Description:
Walter Isaacson, CEO of the Aspen Institute, former chairman of CNN and former managing editor of Time, closes the Seven Days of Genius festival with a lecture on the one-in-a-million geniuses whose work has impacted every aspect of our lives today: the people who created the computer and the internet.

How did their minds work? What made them so inventive? And how can their innovation, creativity and teamwork inform our own out-of-the-box thinking today?

There will be a selling and signing of Walter Isaacson's new book, The Innovators: How a Group of Hackers, Geniuses, and Geeks Created the Digital Revolution, following the event.

Description:
“It seems safe to say that Capital in the Twenty-First Century, the magnum opus of the French economist Thomas Piketty, will be the most important economics book of the year—and maybe of the decade.

Piketty, arguably the world’s leading expert on income and wealth inequality, does more than document the growing concentration of income in the hands of a small economic elite. He also makes a powerful case that we’re on the way back to ‘patrimonial capitalism,’ in which the commanding heights of the economy are dominated not just by wealth, but also by inherited wealth, in which birth matters more than effort and talent,” wrote Paul Krugman in The New York Times. Krugman and his fellow Nobel laureate Joseph Stiglitz (author of The Great Divide) join Piketty to discuss the genius of economics.

The extraordinary resilience of the Jewish people—in the face of adversity through every generation since Moses—gives power and resonance to their collective vision, and provides the key to Jewish identity and sense of purpose.

Description:
What is the genius of religion and faith? Can religion claim itself as the source of morality and moral behavior?

The archbishop of New York is joined by Rabbi Peter J. Rubinstein, 92nd Street Y’s director of Jewish community and the Bronfman Center for Jewish Life, to explore the moral aspects and traits of the genius of religion, such as generosity, curiosity and duty. They’ll look at how individuals such as Mother Teresa, Elie Wiesel, Martin Luther King, Jr. and Gandhi have inspired and harnessed the power of communities for good, and explore how the great partnerships between faiths can heal our world.

Description:
It’s that time of year again—92Y celebrates all great things chocolate!

Meet some of the world’s most talented tastemakers. Stefano De Martini, of Torino’s De Martini Cioccolato fame, visits from Italy. International Chocolate Awards 2013 Gold Medal Winner Hakan Martensson of Fika Choklad (with his unique Caramelized Quinoa Hazelnut Gianduia) teams up with Clay Gordon and Solbeso, the world's first spirit distilled from cacao pulp). Joan Coukos of Chocolat Moderne joins Murray's Cheese to create palate-thrilling pairings, and returning by popular demand, Brooklyn's own Liz and Jen of Liddabit Sweets. Our lineup also includes wine and spirits expert Costas Mouzouras (Gotham Wines and Liquors) who will team up with Guittard for some spirited chocolate pairings. Candy bar maven Fixx joins us from Boston, and ganache guru Chocolate in Chelsea appears for the first time. Our party would be incomplete without luscious Lush Candy, The Cacaoist, Pralus, Bonnat, MP Frederick Confectioners and newcomer Eclair Bakery plus Penny Lick Ice Cream brings cold chocolate delights.

With award-winning chocolate bars, chocolate-friendly cheeses, and edgy choco-beverage pairings, all together we’ll redefine chocolate as our favorite food.
ShortDesc: It’s that time of year again—92Y celebrates all great things chocolate!
Title: Chocolate Fest: A Walk-Around Tasting

Description:
Photo Credit: Simon Emmett

January 2015 will mark a century of the United States’s war on drugs: one hundred years since the first arrests under the Harrison Act.

Facing down this anniversary, journalist Johann Hari wanted to explore the larger contours of the story—to find out why the war began, why it continues and how to move beyond it. Join Hari as he shares his twenty-thousand-mile global journey into the drug war’s many facets and its dramatic human stories: The first commissioner of the Federal Bureau of Narcotics, whose revulsion to drugs began as a child with the overheard screams of a neighbor going through withdrawal. A mother in Mexico who spent years tracking her daughter’s murderer. A child smuggled out of the ghetto during the Holocaust who later helped unlock the science of addiction. A man who led his country to decriminalize all drugs—from cannabis to crack. Hari then brings us back to the United States, where the war was instigated and exported, but where change is also coming.

 

Brief Bio

Johann Hari has written for many of the world’s leading newspapers, including The New York Times, Le Monde and the Guardian. He was twice named Journalist of the Year by Amnesty International, for his reporting on the war in the Central African Republic and on the fall of Dubai. He has also been named Journalist of the Year by Stonewall. From the age of twenty-three, he was one of the leading op-ed columnists for the Independent.

Join Hari as he shares his twenty-thousand-mile global journey into the drug war’s many facets and its dramatic human stories: The first commissioner of the Federal Bureau of Narcotics, whose revulsion to drugs began as a child with the overheard screams of a neighbor going through withdrawal. A mother in Mexico who spent years tracking her daughter’s murderer. A child smuggled out of the ghetto during the Holocaust who later helped unlock the science of addiction. A man who led his country to decriminalize all drugs—from cannabis to crack. Hari then brings us back to the United States, where the war was instigated and exported, but where change is also coming.
ShortDesc: January 2015 will mark a century of the United States’s war on drugs: one hundred years since the first arrests under the Harrison Act.
Title: One Hundred Years of the War on Drugs

Description:
Emmy® Award-winning actor/writer/comedian Wanda Sykes has been called "one of the funniest stand-up comics" by her peers and ranks among Entertainment Weekly's 25 Funniest People in America.

No wonder she works regularly with the likes of Larry David, Chris Rock and Gary Trudeau on such shows and films as “Curb Your Enthusiasm,” “The Chris Rock Show,” Pootie Tang and the Amazon Prime series “Alpha House.” In 2009, Sykes was the featured entertainer for the annual White House Correspondents' Association dinner, becoming both the first African American woman and the first openly LGBT person to get the role; the following year she won a 2010 GLAAD award for promoting a good image of equal rights for gays and lesbians. Join us as Sykes talks about her life and unique career with fellow comedian/LGBT activist Judy Gold.

Description:
Two-time winner of the Pulitzer Prize David McCullough talks with pre-eminent historical documentarian, Ken Burns, telling the dramatic story-behind the story of the courageous brothers who taught the world how to fly: Wilber and Orville Wright.

There will be a book selling and signing of David McCullough's new book, The Wright Brothers, following the program.

 

Can't make it to the event? Leave your questions for our guests below, and they might be used on stage during the Q&A. Keep an eye on 92Y On Demand after the event for any video clips we might share! You might see your question used on stage.

 
 

Brief Bios

David McCullough has twice received the Pulitzer Prize, for Truman and John Adams, and twice received the National Book Award, for The Path Between the Seas and Mornings on Horseback. His other acclaimed books are 1776, Brave Companions, The Johnstown Flood, The Great Bridge and The Greater Journey. He is the recipient of numerous honors and awards, including the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation’s highest civilian award. He is the author of a new book The Wright Brothers.

Ken Burns has been making films for more than thirty-five years. Since the Academy Award nominated Brooklyn Bridge in 1981, Ken has gone on to direct and produce some of the most acclaimed historical documentaries ever made. Ken’s films have won thirteen Emmy Awards and two Oscar nominations, and in September of 2008, at the News & Documentary Emmy Awards, Ken was honored by the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences with a Lifetime Achievement Award.

There will be a book selling and signing of David McCullough's new book, The Wright Brothers, following the program.

Title: David McCullough with Ken Burns: On the Wright Brothers

Description:
Two consummate Broadway babies are back onstage—she for the first time since 2010’s hit Promises and Promises, and he in his first musical appearance since 1992’s legendary Guys and Dolls.

Join Tony®-winning diva Kristin Chenoweth and Golden Globe winner Peter Gallagher as they trade intimate stories of balancing their incredibly varied careers—in theater, film, TV and music—and their lives outside the limelight. Discover how these stars sustain their passion, and hear tidbits on Roundabout Theatre Company’s new hot-ticket revival of the madcap musical comedy On the Twentieth Century.
ShortDesc: Two consummate Broadway babies are back onstage—she for the first time since 2010’s hit Promises and Promises, and he in his first musical appearance since 1992’s legendary Guys and Dolls.
Title: Back on Broadway: Kristin Chenoweth and Peter Gallagher in Conversation

Description:
"The Whites is the crime novel of the year—grim, gutsy, and impossible to put down. I had to read the final 100 pages in a single sitting. I began being fascinated, and ended being deeply moved. Call him Price or Brandt, he knows everything about police life, and plenty about friendship: what your friends do for you…and what they sometimes do to you."—Stephen King

Richard Price, one of America’s most gifted novelists, has always written brilliantly about cops, criminals and New York City. Now, writing as Harry Brandt, he is poised to win a huge following among all those who hunger for first-rate crime fiction. Join him and David Simon (“The Wire”) for a conversation about The Whites.

About The Whites

Back in the run-and-gun days of the mid-90s, when Billy Graves worked in the South Bronx as part of an anti-crime unit known as the Wild Geese, he made headlines by accidentally shooting a 10-year-old boy while stopping an angel-dusted berserker in the street. Branded as a cowboy by his higher-ups, for the next eighteen years Billy endured one dead-end posting after another. Now in his early forties, he has somehow survived and become a sergeant in Manhattan Night Watch, a small team of detectives charged with responding to all night-time felonies from Wall Street to Harlem.

Night Watch usually acts a set-up crew for the day shift, but when Billy is called to a 4:00 a.m. fatal slashing of a man in Penn Station, his investigation of the crime moves beyond the usual handoff. And when he discovers that the victim was once a suspect in the unsolved murder of a 12-year-old boy—a brutal case with connections to the former members of the Wild Geese—the bad old days are back in Billy's life with a vengeance, tearing apart enduring friendships forged in the urban trenches and even threatening the safety of his family.

 

Can't make it to the event? Leave your questions for our guests below, and they might be used on stage during the Q&A. Keep an eye on 92Y On Demand after the event for any video clips we might share! You might see your question used on stage.

Description:
Fashion industry icon Mark Weber—longtime CEO of Donna Karan International—reveals the secrets to building a successful career in one of the world's most fascinating businesses.

Join Weber as he shares stories from his rise to the top of the fashion and luxury goods industries and provides practical advice for anyone in any creative industry. He’ll explain the ins and outs young professionals need to know to launch themselves to the top, including ways to stand out from their co-workers, how to handle publicity—both good and bad, how to manage global brands and succeed in a global marketplace, and how to lead a company through change.

Mark Weber will be signing copies of his book, Always in Fashion: From Clerk to CEO—Lessons for Success in Business and in Life, following the event.

 
 

Brief Bio

Mark Weber began his career at Phillips-Van Heusen Corporation (PVH), becoming president, board member and CEO. He joined LVMH in 2006 as Chairman and CEO of Donna Karan International Inc., leading the growth of the Donna Karan and DKNY brands in emerging markets, notably China and India.

Description:
Göran Rosenberg, one of Sweden's most eminent writers and journalists, is a man driven by "a lust for research" who retraces his father's path to Sweden, when he struggles with loss, employment, housing, small-town life and a bureaucracy almost unable to comprehend the psychological consequences of surviving the concentration camps.

This is a son's moving account of his father's struggle to build a life in Sweden after Auschwitz, and a journey to discover the truth decades later.

Description:
Enjoy an evening of conversation and musical performances from the cast and creative team of the new Broadway musical Doctor Zhivago, as they discuss bringing this timeless tale of romance and revolution to the Broadway stage.

Epic romance returns to Broadway this March in the new musical Doctor Zhivago, with a sweeping score by two-time Grammy Award winner and Tony Award nominee Lucy Simon. Tony Award winning director Des McAnuff and composer Lucy Simon will discuss the road to Broadway, bringing the Russian Revolution to the stage, and making Doctor Zhivago sing. This is mark the first time the show’s stars Tam Mutu and Kelli Barrett will perform songs from the new musical in New York.

Description:
Richard Thaler Photo Credit: France Leclerc

Behavioral economist Richard Thaler talks to bestselling author Malcolm Gladwell on the implications of behavioral economics on how we think about the world, from our personal lives to business to society.

They will have you retooling your grocery list and retirement strategies, and lead managers to rethink every aspect of their business.

There will be a selling and signing of Richard Thayer’s new book, Misbehaving: The Making of Behavioral Economics, following the event.

 

Can't make it to the event? Leave your questions for our guests below, and they might be used on stage during the Q&A. Keep an eye on 92Y On Demand after the event for any video clips we might share! You might see your question used on stage.

 
 

Brief Bios

Richard H. Thaler is a celebrated economist and co-author of the bestselling Nudge. He is a professor of behavioral science and economics at the University of Chicago Graduate School of Business and, in 2015, the president of the American Economic Association. He lives in Chicago.

Malcolm Gladwell, the #1 bestselling author of David and Goliath, The Tipping Point, Blink and several other books, has been a staff writer at The New Yorker since 1996. Prior to that, he was a reporter at the Washington Post. Gladwell was born in England and grew up in rural Ontario. He now lives in New York.
MobileDesc: Behavioral economist Richard Thaler talks to bestselling author Malcolm Gladwell on the implications of behavioral economics on how we think about the world, from our personal lives to business to society. They will have you retooling your grocery list and retirement strategies, and lead managers to rethink every aspect of their business.
ShortDesc: Behavioral economist Richard Thaler talks to bestselling author Malcolm Gladwell on the implications of behavioral economics on how we think about the world, from our personal lives to business to society.
Title: Misbehaving: Richard Thaler in Conversation with Malcolm Gladwell

Description:
Join historian Andrew Morton for a true story steeped in intrigue, suspense and historical drama.

Drawing on FBI documents, material from the German and British Royal Archives, and the personal correspondence of Churchill, Truman, Eisenhower and the Windsors themselves, Morton unveils the shadowy connection between the House of Windsor, the German aristocracy and Hitler—and the cover up that followed.

Morton will be signing copies of 17 Carnations: The Royals, the Nazis and the Biggest Cover-Up in History following the event.

 

Brief Bio

Andrew Morton studied history at the University of Sussex, England with a focus on aristocracy and the 1930s. He is an acclaimed journalist and writer, the bestselling author of a number of biographies featuring the British Royal Family as well as celebrities including Tom Cruise, Angelina Jolie and Madonna. His bestselling biography of Princess Diana, Diana: Her True Story, met with international acclaim as "the closest we will ever come to her autobiography."

The Royal Shakespeare Company recently adapted Wolf Hall and Bring Up the Bodies for the stage to colossal critical acclaim, which opens on Broadway in April. There is also a BBC/Masterpiece six-part adaption of the novels, which will be broadcast on PBS in 2015.

Description:
Bestselling author and legendary political analyst Cokie Roberts talks about the women who have helped shape our nation throughout our tumultuous history.

Hear extraordinary stories of their triumphs and struggles and learn about the vital contribution women have made to the success of our country.

 

Can't make it to the event? Leave your questions for our guests below, and they might be used on stage during the Q&A. Keep an eye on 92Y On Demand after the event for any video clips we might share! You might see your question used on stage.

 
 

Bio

Cokie Roberts is a political commentator for ABC News and NPR. She has won countless awards, and in 2008 she was named a “Living Legend” by the Library of Congress. She is the author of the number one New York Times bestseller We Are Our Mothers’ Daughters. Her other books, Founding Mothers, Ladies of Liberty and From This Day Forward (written with her husband, journalist Steven V. Roberts), also spent weeks on the bestseller list. She and her husband have also collaborated on Our Haggadah. Roberts is the mother of two and grandmother of six.

Discover the inspiring untold story of the Machal—the World War II pilots, mostly American and British, who volunteered to fight for Israel in the 1948 War of Independence.

Roberta Grossman’s Above and Beyond is the first major documentary to pay tribute to these unsung heroes, who saved Israel from immediate destruction and gave rise to the Israeli Air Force. Producer Nancy Spielberg joins us for an inside look at this powerful new film.

Science rapper Baba Brinkman (Rap Guide to Evolution) teams up with neuroscientist Dr. Heather Berlin, neuropsychologist Rex Jung and cognitive psychologist and science writer Scott Barry Kaufman to explore the brain basis of improvisation, mixing freestyle rap with the latest research.

What’s going on “under the hood” when a comedian or musician improvises? Why are the spontaneous moments of life always the most memorable? Does anything actually rhyme with Dorsolateral Prefrontal Cortex? A new marriage of science and spontaneous creativity.

"Geek heaven... who says science is boring?" ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ Edinburgh Reporter

Description:
Genius and Madness—Many of the most recognized geniuses in history suffered from some sort of mental illness. Is there a link between creativity and mental illness? What do we currently understand about any connection?

Renowned psychoanalyst, author and "TODAY" show contributor Dr. Gail Saltz explores this topic with: Dean Keith Simonton, Distinguished Professor of Psychology at the University of California, Davis, who has devoted 40 years to the scientific study of genius, creativity and leadership;  James C. Kaufman, Professor of Educational Psychology at the Neag School of Education at the University of Connecticut, and the author/editor of more than 30 books; and Sylvia Nasar, former economics correspondent at The New York Times and the author of A Beautiful Mind.

 

Can't make it to the event? Leave your questions for our guests below, and they might be used on stage during the Q&A. Keep an eye on 92Y On Demand after the event for any video clips we might share! You might see your question used on stage.

Description:
While April Bloomfield, chef and owner of Michelin-starred restaurants the Spotted Pig, the Breslin Bar & Dining Room, the John Dory Oyster Bar, Salvation Taco, and Tosca, is nearly synonymous with nose-to-tail eating (see A Girl and Her Pig), she does have a lighter side.

For her, unforgettable food comes out of simple, honest ingredients, attention to detail, and a love for the sensual pleasures of cooking and eating. Join Chef Bloomfield as she shares her tantalizing seasonal recipes, techniques and sources of inspiration.

 

Can't make it to the event? Leave your questions for our guests below, and they might be used on stage during the Q&A. Keep an eye on 92Y On Demand after the event for any video clips we might share! You might see your question used on stage.

 
 

Brief Bios

April Bloomfield is the executive chef and co-owner with Ken Friedman of the Michelin-starred restuarants The Spotted Pig, The Breslin Bar & Dining Room, The John Dory Oyster Bar, Salvation Taco and Tosca. She has worked at The River Café in London and Chez Panisse in Berkeley, California, among other celebrated restaurants.

Christine Muhlke is the executive editor of Bon Appétit and the former food editor of The New York Times Magazine. She co-wrote Manresa with David Kinch, On the Line with Eric Ripert and the upcoming Hartwood cookbook with Eric Werner. Her writing has also appeared in Vogue, Lucky Peach, Cherry Bombe, Vanity Fair and other publications.

Description:

Hear what’s next for this triple threat—including Season 3 of “ Mr. Selfridge” and the upcoming "Entourage" feature film.

Description:
What are the secrets to healthy running? What makes runners successful? Is there a “best” way to run? How can you benefit from these secrets with your own running?

With record numbers of runners of all ages hitting the roads and trails around the world, running is enjoying a renaissance. Join an all-star panel as they explore a variety of topics on healthy running ­ from stories and insights into the world of running, to tips from the foremost authorities on staying healthy and training for success. Whether you¹re a weekend warrior or are gearing up for your next ultra marathon, don¹t miss this inspiring discussion.
ShortDesc: What are the secrets to healthy running? What makes runners successful? Is there a “best” way to run? How can you benefit from these secrets with your own running?
Title: Running Strong: Keys to Happy, Healthy, Successful Running for Life

Description:
It’s easy to identify history’s evil geniuses—the Hitlers and Stalins—but who are the moral geniuses among us?

And what does it take to be one? How can science and religion help us do great work in the world—and stop us from using our singular human intelligence for ill? Get to the very heart of right and wrong when Professor Michael Shermer, editor of Skeptic magazine and author of The Moral Arc, and RELIGIOUS THINKER, join in conversation with Rabbi Geoffrey A. Mitelman, founding director of Sinai and Synapses.

 

Can't make it to the event? Leave your questions for our guests below, and they might be used on stage during the Q&A. Keep an eye on 92Y On Demand after the event for any video clips we might share! You might see your question used on stage.

 
 

Brief Bio

Dr. Michael Shermer is the Publisher of Skeptic magazine, a monthly columnist for Scientific American, a regular contributor to Time.com and a Presidential Fellow at Chapman University. His latest book is The Moral Arc: How Science and Reason Lead Humanity Toward Truth, Justice, and Freedom.

Description:
“Israel has had critical elections before, but this could be its most important,” writes Thomas L. Friedman in The New York Times.

Indeed, March 17 represents nothing less than a referendum on the direction of the entire Jewish state—which today faces threats from all sides and sharp conflict within. Gain a deep understanding of this high-stakes election and its key players from an expert on the region—Ambassador Alon Pinkas, former consul general of Israel in New York and Congressman Steve Israel who offers an American insiders' perspective on Congress, including US-Israeli relations, the Iran negotiations and the remaining term.

There will be a book selling and signing of Steve Israel’s bestselling novel, a witty satire entitled: The Global War on Morris, following the event.

Description:
Tim Gunn Photo Credit: Scott McDermott

Beloved pop culture icon and New York Times bestselling author Tim Gunn is best known as co-host of the twelve-time Emmy-nominated reality show "Project Runway."

He also hosted two seasons of his own Bravo makeover series, "Tim Gunn’s Guide to Style," and is the host of the reality TV series "Under the Gunn," which premiered in January 2014 on Lifetime. He's the author of a new book The Natty Professor: A Master Class on Mentoring, Motivating, and Making It Work!

Brief Bio

The award-winning creator and organizer of Fashion Week in New York and cities across the globe, Fern Mallis has been an industry game changer in the world of fashion and design for 32 years. A former senior vice president of IMG Fashion and executive director of CFDA, she hosts fashion-industry talk show “Fashion Insiders with Fern Mallis” on SiriusXM’s flagship celebrity talk channel, Stars. She is currently the president of her own leading international fashion and design consultancy, Fern Mallis LLC.

Description:
Six years ago he gave us Happiness, a bestseller that has helped millions lead more satisfied lives.

Now Matthieu Ricard, the French molecular biologist turned Buddhist monk, returns with the groundbreaking Altruism, which shows that altruism is more than a lofty ideal—it’s a quality that resides within us all. And if we tap into it, we can change our world today. Draw fresh wisdom from the guru whose TED talk has been viewed nearly five million times when he joins Richard Gere—actor, activist and Buddhist—in conversation.

About the Book:

Altruism is Matthieu Ricard’s new masterwork presenting a global vision based on decades personal experience and insight, a roadmap for the 21st century.

Ricard demonstrates how altruism is not an abstract ideal, but an essential dimension of our nature that everyone can cultivate. He explains how it is the vital thread that can answer the main challenges of our time: economic inequality, life satisfaction and environmental sustainability. Altruism was a bestseller in France and will be published in the U.S. on June 2, 2015, by Little Brown. 

 

Can't make it to the event? Leave your questions for our guests below, and they might be used on stage during the Q&A. Keep an eye on 92Y On Demand after the event for any video clips we might share! You might see your question used on stage.

 
 

Brief Bio

Born in France in 1946, Matthieu Ricard is a Buddhist monk who left a career in cellular genetics to study Buddhism in the Himalayas over 45 years ago. As a trained scientist and Buddhist monk, he is uniquely positioned in the dialogue between East and West. He is an international best-selling author and a prominent speaker on the world stage, celebrated at the World Economic Forum at Davos and at TED where over four million people have viewed his talk on happiness. www.matthieuricard.com www.karuna-shechen.org

Description:
It takes a special kind of genius to defeat a giant.

Young David did it with a stone, just as other underdogs of history—in fields as diverse as politics, business and science—have beaten gigantic odds to come out on top. How do these miraculous people triumph despite vast disadvantages? Malcolm Gladwell, the mind behind modern classics like Blink and Outliers, has an answer, and it’s contained in his bold new book, David and Goliath. Join him to discover why the dark horse can ultimately win the race.

Standard priced tickets include a paperback copy of David and Goliath.

 

Can't make it to the event? Leave your questions for our guests below, and they might be used on stage during the Q&A. Keep an eye on 92Y On Demand after the event for any video clips we might share! You might see your question used on stage.

 
 

Brief Bio

Malcolm Gladwell, the #1 bestselling author of David and Goliath, The Tipping Point, Blink and several other books, has been a staff writer at The New Yorker since 1996. Prior to that, he was a reporter at the Washington Post. Gladwell was born in England and grew up in rural Ontario. He now lives in New York.

Description:
Quacks and crazies—that’s how society once thought of psychiatrists and their patients.

Flash forward to today, and find a flourishing medical discipline buoyed by a burgeoning scientific knowledge base that is helping millions of the mentally ill and can offer aid to tens of millions more still going untreated. How did we get here? In Shrinks: The Untold Story of Psychiatry, Columbia University’s Dr. Jeffrey Lieberman tells the riveting tale of his profession's battles and breakthroughs, mistakes and miraculous serendipities—with a focus on game-changing figures, from Sigmund Freud to neuroscientist Dr. Eric Kandel. Join Dr. Kandel, a Nobel Prize winner for his brain research, and Dr. Lieberman to discover what is the truth about mental illness, how far psychiatry has come—and why destructive stigmas still persist.

 

Can't make it to the event? Leave your questions for our guests below, and they might be used on stage during the Q&A. Keep an eye on 92Y On Demand after the event for any video clips we might share! You might see your question used on stage.

Description:
It’s been 13.8 billion years since the Big Bang began our universe—are we finally on the brink of unraveling its mystery?

Renowned theoretical physicist Brian Greene says yes—thanks to thousands of years of exploration by geniuses ranging from Galileo to Hawking. How has the human race gone from stargazing in ancient Greece to the string theory of today? Find out on a riveting journey through millennia of scientific progress, and all the way back to the birth of time, with the bestselling author of The Elegant Universe.

 

Can't make it to the event? Leave your questions for our guests below, and they might be used on stage during the Q&A. Keep an eye on 92Y On Demand after the event for any video clips we might share! You might see your question used on stage.

Description:
Few Westerners know more about Iraq than British expert Emma Sky.

She volunteered to help rebuild the nation after Saddam Hussein’s fall in 2003—and never left. As a political adviser to coalition forces and a confidante of US generals, she bore witness to a decade of disaster. And in her must-read new book, The Unraveling, she tells us what went wrong. Gain unparalleled insight into one of recent history’s most tragic chapters when she sits down with General David Petraeus, who oversaw American troops in Iraq and Afghanistan.

Description:
Libertarianism—the philosophy of personal and economic freedom—has deep roots in Western civilization and in American history, and it’s growing stronger.

Two long wars, chronic deficits, the financial crisis, the costly drug war, the campaigns of Ron Paul and Rand Paul, the growth of executive power under Presidents Bush and Obama, and the revelations about NSA abuses have pushed millions more Americans in a libertarian direction. Learn more about this important political movement.

Description:
Danielle Paige is the New York Times bestselling author of the Dorothy Must Die series. Before turning to young adult literature, she worked in television industry where she received a Writers Guild of America award and was nominated for several Daytime Emmys. Danielle lives in New York City. Facebook: dorothymustdie, Twitter: @daniellempaige

Upcoming Book: The Wicked Will Rise (Dorothy Must Die #2), on-sale 3/31/15.
 

 
 

Soman Chainani believes in fairy tales wholeheartedly. When studying at Harvard, he practically created his own fairy-tale major. He is an acclaimed screenwriter and a graduate of the MFA Film Directing Program at Columbia University. His films have played at more than 150 film festivals around the world, and his writing awards include an honor from the Sun Valley Writers’ Conference. He lives in New York City. You can visit him online at www.somanchainani.com.

Recent Books: The School for Good and Evil #1 and #2

Christopher Healy has been deeply immersed in children’s media for most of the past decade. He was the Culture Editor and lead reviewer of children’s books (as well as movies, music, games and TV) for the entire five-year run of Cookie magazine, and for the past year, he has covered the same beat online, in his regular column “KidPop” on AOL’s ParentDish.com (where he also provides illustrations). In that time he has also been working as an editor/reviewer for Common Sense Media, the web’s biggest site for parent-focused entertainment reviews, as well as covering children’s entertainment for iVillage, Parenting, Time Out New York Kids and Real Simple Family. He lives with his wife, Noelle, and his two children, Bryn, 9, and Dash, 4, in Maplewood, New Jersey.

Recent Book: The Hero's Guide to Being an Outlaw (Conclusion to the series), on-sale 4/29/2014.
